game_description: Explore a giant world made of blocks and modify it with your own creations. Construct houses, build entire villages, cities, monumental constructions or dig deep underground. Place torches or design complex electric circuits to light up your creations in the dark and enjoy beautiful day and night cycles. • Creative sandbox block-building experience: Create your own worlds with more than 215 unique materials. • Jump into Virtual Reality and experience your block world as if you were there with incredible 360 degrees immersion. • Inking system: Customize the blocks with 16 different colors for your own look. • Multiplayer: Play together with 4 friends online. • Build-In World Gallery: Share you creations with the community or Download and Rate other players worlds easily with the built-in online world gallery. • Easy accessibility, Simple controls
Languages: English, French (France), German, Italian, Portuguese (Portugal), Spanish (Spain)
review_1: Please add survivor mode it would have way more people and there isn’t enough buildings surviving game and it would be a blast to be marking a lot of money for this game or make it free if u don’t want to update
review_2: TL,DR: a better version of the original, definitely worth the $10. I remember getting the app for the first time on the wii u. I remember loving it, because it was like a better version on minecraft. Sure, it doesn't have as many animals as minecraft, but it makes up for it with the materials it gives you, including the ability to do custom lighting and the ability to change colors of diffrent block. I didn't think they could make it better, but they somehow did. They made it possible to play in vr and gave some extra blocks to go with it. Keep making the game as good as it is now.
review_3: I was hesitant to pay $10 for the full version of this instead of getting the free lite version through side quest. I’m glad I paid to get the full version. It has more to work with like letters, lights, and even paint! Graphics are a bit more realistic too. I do wish it had more to work with for what I’m wanting to build like train tracks, maybe beds if I want to build a hotel or a house, ladders, and a mine cart to put on a train track if I want to build a roller coaster. I’m sure we’ll see that in one of the next updates though 🤞🏻. I can make do with what I got so far. Other than that… I really enjoy this and spent hours on it building something big. I’m excited to see how my builds in this thing turn out. I’m also excited for improvements they decide to make in the future for this game too like mentioned earlier, more objects to work with. That said… don’t hesitate to buy this awesome VR world building game.
